meanings.definition: A light, hollow roll made from an egg batter similar to that for Yorkshire pudding.
meanings.sent1: I baked some delicious popovers for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street sells the best popovers in town.
meanings.sent3: The popovers at the party were gone in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room like the airy texture of popovers.
meanings.sent5: The warm popovers melted in my mouth, leaving a delightful taste.

meanings.definition: To burst with a popping sound.
meanings.sent1: The balloon suddenly popovers, startling everyone.
meanings.sent2: When I stepped on the bubble wrap, it made a loud popovers.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as the bubble wrap continued to popover.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was about to reach its peak and then suddenly popovers!
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air was palpable, ready to popover at any moment.
